info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 08 at 7:19PM MDT until June 08 at 8:45PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL GLACIER, NORTHWESTERN PONDERA, WESTERN TETON AND NORTHWESTERN LEWIS AND CLARK COUNTIES... At 719 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges continued to indicate that heavy rain was falling across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Rainfall rates are expected to between 0.25 to 0.5 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, streets, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. Debris flows in steep mountainous terrain are likely to occur, especially near recently burned areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Heart Butte, Pishkun Reservoir, Dupuyer and Nilan Reservoir. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25-0.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
